apiDesc.p: Client-side handle to a session with a server.
This is the client-side interface through which communication with the server is channelled.
Clients normally define and implement a derived class to provide a richer interface.
Indicates whether or not threads in the process are automatically attached to the session when passed as a parameter to the Share() function.

cxxFunctionDefinition.cxxFunctionPrototype: inline TInt ShareAuto()

apiDesc.p: Creates a session that can be shared by other threads in the current process.
After calling this function the session object may be used by threads other than than the one that created it.
Note that this can only be done with servers that mark their sessions as sharable.
KErrNone, if the session is successfully shared; KErrNoMmemory, if the attempt fails for lack of memory.
KERN-EXEC 23 The session cannot be shared.

cxxFunctionDefinition.cxxFunctionPrototype: inline TInt ShareProtected()

apiDesc.p: Creates a session handle that can be be passed via IPC to another process as well as being shared by other threads in the current process.
After calling this function the session object may be used by threads other than than the one that created it.
Note that this can only be done with servers that mark their sessions as globally sharable.
KErrNone, if the session is successfully shared; KErrNoMmemory, if the attempt fails for lack of memory.
KERN-EXEC 23 The session cannot be shared.

cxxFunctionDefinition.cxxFunctionPrototype: IMPORT_C TInt Open(RMessagePtr2 aMessage, TInt aParam, TOwnerType aType=EOwnerProcess)
IMPORT_C TInt Open(RMessagePtr2 aMessage, TInt aParam, const TSecurityPolicy &aServerPolicy, TOwnerType aType=EOwnerProcess)
IMPORT_C TInt Open(TInt aArgumentIndex, TOwnerType aType=EOwnerProcess)
IMPORT_C TInt Open(TInt aArgumentIndex, const TSecurityPolicy &aServerPolicy, TOwnerType aType=EOwnerProcess)
inline TInt SetReturnedHandle(TInt aHandleOrError)

cxxFunctionParameter.apiDefNote: A handle-number, if zero or positive; an error value, if negative.

apiDesc.p: Sets the handle-number of this handle to the specified value.
The function can take a (zero or positive) handle-number, or a (negative) error number.

If aHandleOrError represents a handle-number, then the handle-number of this handle is set to that value. If aHandleOrError represents an error number, then the handle-number of this handle is set to zero and the negative value is returned.
KErrNone, if aHandle is a handle-number; the value of aHandleOrError, otherwise.

cxxFunctionDefinition.cxxFunctionPrototype: IMPORT_C TInt SetReturnedHandle(TInt aHandleOrError, const TSecurityPolicy &aServerPolicy)
inline TInt CreateSession(const TDesC &aServer, const TVersion &aVersion)

cxxFunctionParameter.apiDefNote: The name of the server with which a session is to be established.
The lowest version of the server with which this client is compatible

apiDesc.p: Creates a session with a server, specifying no message slots.
It should be called as part of session initialisation in the derived class.

Message slots are not pre-allocated for the session but are taken from a system-wide pool allowing up to 255 asynchronous messages to be outstanding. This raises a risk of failure due to lack of memory and, therefore, this mode of operation is not viable for sessions that make guarantees about the failure modes of asynchonous services.
KErrNone if successful, otherwise one of the other system-wide error codes.

cxxFunctionDefinition.cxxFunctionPrototype: IMPORT_C TInt CreateSession(const TDesC &aServer, const TVersion &aVersion, TInt aAsyncMessageSlots)
IMPORT_C TInt CreateSession(const TDesC &aServer, const TVersion &aVersion, TInt aAsyncMessageSlots, TIpcSessionType aType, const TSecurityPolicy *aPolicy=0, TRequestStatus *aStatus=0)
inline TInt CreateSession(RServer2 aServer, const TVersion &aVersion)

cxxFunctionParameter.apiDefNote: A handle to a server with which a session is to be established.
The lowest version of the server with which this client is compatible

apiDesc.p: Creates a session with a server, specifying no message slots.
It should be called as part of session initialisation in the derived class.

Message slots are not pre-allocated for the session but are taken from a system-wide pool allowing up to 255 asynchronous messages to be outstanding. This raises a risk of failure due to lack of memory and, therefore, this mode of operation is not viable for sessions that make guarantees about the failure modes of asynchonous services.
KErrNone if successful, otherwise one of the other system-wide error codes.

inline static TInt SetReturnedHandle(TInt aHandleOrError, RHandleBase &aHandle)

apiDesc.p: Use CreateSession(const TDesC& aServer,const TVersion& aVersion,TInt aAsyncMessageSlots,TIpcSessionType aType,const TSecurityPolicy* aPolicy=0, TRequestStatus* aStatus=0);

cxxFunctionDefinition.cxxFunctionPrototype: inline TInt Send(TInt aFunction, const TIpcArgs &aArgs) const

cxxFunctionParameter.apiDefNote: The function number identifying the request.
A set of up to 4 arguments and their types to be passed to the server.

apiDesc.p: Issues a blind request to the server with the specified function number, and arguments.
A blind request is one where the server does not issue a response to the client.

KErrNone, if the send operation is successful; KErrServerTerminated, if the server no longer present; KErrServerBusy, if there are no message slots available; KErrNoMemory, if there is insufficient memory available.
USER 72 if the function number is negative.

cxxFunctionDefinition.cxxFunctionPrototype: inline void SendReceive(TInt aFunction, const TIpcArgs &aArgs, TRequestStatus &aStatus) const

cxxFunctionParameter.apiDefNote: The function number identifying the request.
A set of up to 4 arguments and their types to be passed to the server.
The request status object used to contain the completion status of the request.

apiDesc.p: Issues an asynchronous request to the server with the specified function number and arguments.
The completion status of the request is returned via the request status object, aStatus.
USER 72 if the function number is negative.

cxxFunctionDefinition.cxxFunctionPrototype: inline TInt SendReceive(TInt aFunction, const TIpcArgs &aArgs) const

cxxFunctionParameter.apiDefNote: The function number identifying the request.
A set of up to 4 arguments and their types to be passed to the server.

apiDesc.p: Issues a synchronous request to the server with the specified function number and arguments.

KErrNone, if the send operation is successful; KErrServerTerminated, if the server no longer present; KErrServerBusy, if there are no message slots available; KErrNoMemory, if there is insufficient memory available.
USER 72 if the function number is negative.

cxxFunctionDefinition.cxxFunctionPrototype: inline TInt Send(TInt aFunction) const

cxxFunctionParameter.apiDefNote: The function number identifying the request.

apiDesc.p: Issues a blind request to the server with the specified function number, but with no arguments.
A blind request is one where the server does not issue a response to the client.

KErrNone, if the send operation is successful; KErrServerTerminated, if the server no longer present; KErrServerBusy, if there are no message slots available; KErrNoMemory, if there is insufficient memory available.
USER 72 if the function number is negative.

cxxFunctionDefinition.cxxFunctionPrototype: inline void SendReceive(TInt aFunction, TRequestStatus &aStatus) const

cxxFunctionParameter.apiDefNote: The function number identifying the request.
The request status object used to contain the completion status of the request.

apiDesc.p: Issues an asynchronous request to the server with the specified function number, but with no arguments.
The completion status of the request is returned via the request status object, aStatus.
USER 72 if the function number is negative.

cxxFunctionDefinition.cxxFunctionPrototype: inline TInt SendReceive(TInt aFunction) const

cxxFunctionParameter.apiDefNote: The function number identifying the request.

apiDesc.p: Issues a synchronous request to the server with the specified function number, but with no arguments.

KErrNone, if the send operation is successful; KErrServerTerminated, if the server no longer present; KErrServerBusy, if there are no message slots available; KErrNoMemory, if there is insufficient memory available.
USER 72 if the function number is negative.
